intro: Sida montana f. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf sida, is a flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It is native to regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Sida montana f. angustifolia is adapted to thrive in poor soil conditions and is often found in disturbed areas.
